intro: Haenkea flexuosa, commonly known as the flexible haenkea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or stream banks. Its leaves are alternate, often lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs. Haenkea flexuosa produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
